item.title: Hurricane Laura Live Updates: Evacuations Near Houston as Texas Prepares
item.description: Forecasters predicted that Laura, which gained hurricane strength on Tuesday, would become a major Category 3 storm before making landfall near the Louisiana-Texas border.
item.media:credit: William Widmer for The New York Times
item.media:description: Residents boarding up windows at an auto shop in Abbeville, La., on Tuesday.

item.title: Jacob Blake Shooting Prompts Tense Protests and Fires in Several Cities
item.description: Some Wisconsin residents were stunned as buildings went up in flames. Protesters were upset that the police shot Mr. Blake, a Black man, in the back as he tried to enter a vehicle.
item.dc:creator: Julie Bosman
item.media:credit: Carlos Ortiz for The New York Times

item.title: Jerry Falwell Jr.’s Leadership at Liberty Appears Near End
item.description: One of President Trump’s most prominent evangelical supporters, Mr. Falwell denied reports he had resigned from the university.
item.dc:creator: Ruth Graham, Elizabeth Dias and Frances Robles
item.media:credit: Jay Westcott/The News & Advance, via Associated Press
item.media:description: Jerry Falwell Jr. had been on leave from his positions as president and chancellor of Liberty University since Aug. 7.

item.title: 4 Years of Catastrophic Fires in California: ‘I’m Numb’
item.description: For the eight million residents of the San Francisco Bay Area, a ring of fire across Northern California feels inescapable.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Fuller
item.media:credit: Jim Wilson/The New York Times
item.media:description: Smoke from nearby wildfires shrouded Oakland, Calif., on Monday.

item.title: Why the G.O.P. Punted on a New Party Platform for the 2020 R.N.C.
item.description: The Republican National Committee dispensed with producing a new platform, instead renewing what delegates enacted in 2016 and offering wholehearted support for President Trump, whose campaign also released a 50-point plan outlining “core priorities.”
item.dc:creator: Reid J. Epstein
item.media:credit: Pool photo by Travis Dove
item.media:description: “The Republican Party has and will continue to enthusiastically support the president’s America-first agenda” read the resolution, adopted this past weekend in Charlotte, N.C., before the start of the convention.

item.title: The Pandemic’s Economic Crisis Calls for a Green Recovery
item.description: Rachel Kyte, the dean of the Fletcher School at Tufts University, shows what a climate-focused recovery might look like and why the time to get started is right now.
item.dc:creator: Matina Stevis-Gridneff

item.title: Pompeo to Deliver R.N.C. Speech From Israel With Eye on 2024
item.description: No sitting secretary of state has addressed a national political convention in at least 75 years.
item.dc:creator: Lara Jakes
item.media:credit: Pool photo by Debbie Hill
item.media:description: For Secretary of State Mike Pompeo, bolstering Israel serves dual purposes: protecting America’s strongest ally in the volatile Middle East, and appealing to white evangelical voters.

item.title: Republicans mount a revisionist defense of Trump’s record.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Martin, Alexander Burns and Annie Karni
item.media:credit: Pete Marovich for The New York Times
item.media:description: Donald Trump Jr. delivering his address to the Republican National Convention on Monday in Washington.

item.title: Joe Segal, Impresario of Live Jazz for 70 Years, Dies at 94
item.description: His Jazz Showcase was a staple in Chicago since 1947, presenting a who’s who of artists, from Charlie Parker to Dee Dee Bridgewater. To the N.E.A., he was a Jazz Master.
item.dc:creator: Steven Kurutz
item.media:credit: Michael Jackson
item.media:description: Joe Segal in 2003 with a placard for a show by the saxophonist Charles McPherson. Mr. Segal discovered and supported numerous jazz artists.

item.title: The Democrats Are United to Fight Trump, but Policy Fights Are Looming
item.description: The Democratic National Convention showcased Joe Biden’s goals on issues like health care, climate change and the economy. But there is plenty of daylight between his plans and what progressives want to see.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Kaplan and Lisa Friedman
item.media:credit: Erin Schaff/The New York Times
item.media:description: At the Democratic National Convention, the policy agenda for Joseph R. Biden Jr., the Democratic nominee, was sketched out in broad strokes to help him appeal to as wide a universe of voters as possible.

item.title: Heat, Smoke and Covid Are Battering the Workers Who Feed America
item.description: Climate change is piling on to the hazards already faced by California farm laborers, some of the country's poorest, most neglected workers.
item.dc:creator: Somini Sengupta and Brian L. Frank

item.title: Trump offers rare praise for CNN after it broadcast the R.N.C. largely uninterrupted.
item.dc:creator: Neil Vigdor

item.title: California Fires Live Updates: Firefighters Make Progress in ‘Marathon’ Battle
item.description: As some evacuation orders lift, a sheriff warned that “this is a time when some people will realize they no longer have homes.”
item.media:credit: Ian C. Bates for The New York Times
item.media:description: Only a chimney remained at a home destroyed by the L.N.U. Lightning Complex fire in Napa County, Calif., on Monday.

item.title: DeJoy defends postal changes as Trump continues to attack voting by mail.
item.dc:creator: Catie Edmondson
item.media:credit: Anna Moneymaker for The New York Times
item.media:description: Louis DeJoy, the postmaster general, was sworn in for a hearing before the House Oversight and Reform Committee on Monday.

item.title: Police Face Off Against Protesters in Wisconsin
item.description: Protesters and law enforcement officers clashed in Kenosha, Wis., over the shooting of Jacob Blake, a Black man, by a white police officer.
item.dc:creator: Erik Ljung, Katie G. Nelson and McKenzie Marshall
item.media:credit: Carlos Ortiz for The New York Times

item.title: Trump shifts into listening mode, if only briefly.
item.description: On the first night of the Republican National Convention, speakers celebrated President Trump and warned of the economic devastation they believe a Biden administration will bring.
item.dc:creator: Matt Flegenheimer

item.title: California Fires: Why This Year Is Different
item.description: Tuesday: The vast scale of wildfires rampaging across the state is an indication of what’s to come.
item.dc:creator: Jill Cowan
item.media:credit: Jim Wilson/The New York Times
item.media:description: The L.N.U. Lightning Complex Fire has forced evacuations in and around Vacaville.

item.title: Day 2 of the G.O.P. Convention: Schedule, Speakers and How to Watch
item.description: The event’s second night will feature Melania Trump, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo and Senator Rand Paul.
item.dc:creator: Maggie Astor
item.media:credit: Saul Martinez for The New York Times
item.media:description: People watched the Republican National Convention at a restaurant in West Palm Beach, Fla., on Monday. The second night will include a mix of speakers including several Trump family members and top Republican lawmakers.

item.title: Revisionist History at the R.N.C.
item.description: On the first night of the Republican National Convention, speaker after speaker tried to revise reality.
item.dc:creator: Lisa Lerer and Nick Corasaniti

item.title: Virus Laggards
item.description: And what else you need to know today.
item.dc:creator: David Leonhardt
item.media:credit: Oscar Del Pozo/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

item.title: Covid-19 Live Updates: Colleges Suspend Students Over Virus Safety Breaches
item.description: Two people in Europe are found to have been reinfected with the virus. Researchers also say a conference in Boston in February may have spread it to tens of thousands.
item.media:credit: The New York Times

item.title: Where the Produce Includes Pepperoni: The Pizza Farm
item.description: This Midwestern staple has grown ever more popular in the pandemic, bringing farmers and diners together in a socially distanced summer destination.
item.dc:creator: Julia Moskin
item.media:credit: Narayan Mahon for The New York Times
item.media:description: At Luna Valley Farm in Decorah, Iowa, and other pizza farms across the country, the crops become toppings on summer nights.

item.title: Trump’s Fights Are Their Fights. They Have His Back Unapologetically.
item.description: Many supporters of President Trump said in interviews that he had succeeded on issues that matter to them. And they dismissed as unimportant the behavior that critics say makes him unfit for office.
item.dc:creator: Trip Gabriel
item.media:credit: Travis Dove for The New York Times
item.media:description: Supporters like Robin Sinsabaugh of North Carolina view President Trump’s character and policies through a fundamentally different prism than his opponents do.

item.title: Flu Season Could Make Coronavirus Testing Delays Even Worse
item.description: The nation’s testing efforts will be further overwhelmed once influenza, R.S.V. and other seasonal viruses arrive.
item.dc:creator: Katherine J. Wu
item.media:credit: Bryan R. Smith/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
item.media:description: Doctors won’t be able to diagnose patients on a hunch. “The flu season is a bit of a ticking time bomb,” said one expert. “We are all waiting and trying to prepare as best we can.”

item.title: RNC Night 1: Watch the Moments That Mattered
item.description: Two of our reporters break down highlights from the first night (and afternoon) of the Republican National Convention.
item.dc:creator: Shane Goldmacher and Adam Nagourney
item.media:credit: Travis Dove for The New York Times
item.media:description: President Trump spoke to a gathering of delegates in Charlotte, N.C., on Monday.

item.title: Biden Wants Black Voter Turnout Similar to Obama’s. He’ll Need Black Men.
item.description: For Democrats, who rely on Black voters to power their electoral advantages in America’s urban centers, the difference between good and great Black voter turnout is often a question of Black men.
item.dc:creator: Astead W. Herndon
item.media:credit: Gabriela Bhaskar for The New York Times
item.media:description: Gaulien Smith, who owns a barbershop in Milwaukee, said he thought sexism had played a role in some Black male apathy for Hillary Clinton, the 2016 Democratic nominee.

item.title: The New Pandemic Flash Point: Your Vacation
item.description: What kind of travel, if any, is acceptable? Opinions on what’s OK and what’s not are causing fights between family members and fissures among friends.
item.dc:creator: Tariro Mzezewa

item.title: Meet the National Parks’ ‘Ranger of the Lost Art’
item.description: Doug Leen has made it his life’s work to discover, restore and reproduce W.P.A. renderings of America’s threatened public lands.
item.dc:creator: Erin Berger
item.media:credit: Annie Tritt for The New York Times
item.media:description: Doug Leen, a retired dentist who collects and reproduces national park posters created by Works Progress Administration artists, at his home on Alaska’s Kupreanof Island.

item.title: The New Wave of Young Black Activists
item.description: George Floyd’s killing galvanized a nation, but it took a different kind of vision to channel that energy into a movement for political change.
item.dc:creator: Jenna Wortham
item.media:credit: D'Angelo Lovell Williams for The New York Times
item.media:description: The group Black Visions, which is based in Minneapolis and has been integral to the protest movement that erupted following the killing of George Floyd. The group’s founders include, from left: Kandace Montgomery, Miski Noor and Oluchi Omeoga.

item.title: Highlights From the Republican National Convention: Night 1
item.description: On the first night of the convention, Republicans mounted a misleading defense of President Trump’s record.
item.dc:creator: Nilo Tabrizy and Dmitriy Khavin
item.media:credit: Travis Dove for The New York Times
item.media:description: President Trump spoke to a gathering of delegates in Charlotte, N.C., on Monday.

item.title: Full Transcript: Nikki Haley’s R.N.C. Speech
item.description: The former ambassador to the United Nations and former governor of South Carolina warned about socialism in America.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Medina
item.media:credit: Pete Marovich for The New York Times

item.title: The Republicans Promised Uplift and Then Tried to Rewrite History
item.description: On the first night of the party’s convention, President Trump painted a rosy portrait of his handling of the virus, and speakers warned of what they believe a Biden administration could bring.
item.dc:creator: Matt Flegenheimer
item.media:credit: Travis Dove for The New York Times
item.media:description: Outside the Charlotte Convention Center’s Richardson Ballroom, where delegates gathered on Monday.

item.title: Duncan Hunter's Wife Is Sentenced to 8 Months' Home Confinement
item.description: Unlike her husband, a former congressman, she quickly admitted her guilt and cooperated with investigators, officials said.
item.dc:creator: Azi Paybarah
item.media:credit: Gregory Bull/Associated Press
item.media:description: Margaret Hunter, leaving federal court in San Diego on Monday, received a sentence of eight months’ home confinement.

item.title: Insurer Drops Whistle-Blower Lawyer, Citing High-Profile Work
item.description: The decision shows some of the risks for government whistle-blowers and those who work to support them.
item.dc:creator: Maggie Haberman
item.category: Trump-Ukraine Whistle-Blower Complaint and Impeachment Inquiry
item.media:credit: Nikki Kahn/The Washington Post, via Getty Images
item.media:description: “I was literally stunned,” said Mark S. Zaid, one of the lawyers for the government whistle-blower whose concerns sparked an impeachment inquiry last year.

item.title: Radical Break From Tradition: Trump Stages Part of His Convention From the White House
item.description: But President Trump’s convention speech and those of Melania Trump and Secretary of State Mike Pompeo are only the latest examples of how Mr. Trump has further blurred the lines between the government and his campaign.
item.dc:creator: Peter Baker
item.media:credit: Stefani Reynolds for The New York Times
item.media:description: A stage was set up on the South Lawn of the White House, where President Trump plans to accept the Republican Party’s nomination on Thursday.

item.title: Republicans Nominate Trump at RNC, Who Flings Baseless Attacks at Biden
item.description: President Trump and his party engaged in sweeping revisionism about his management of the coronavirus, his record on race relations and much else. And they painted a dystopian picture of what the nation would look like if Joseph R. Biden Jr. were president.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Martin, Alexander Burns and Annie Karni
item.media:credit: Travis Dove for The New York Times
item.media:description: President Trump spoke to a gathering of delegates in Charlotte, N.C., on Monday.

item.title: The One-Man Show Begins: President Trump Takes Center Stage at the RNC
item.description: President Trump takes center stage at the R.N.C.
item.dc:creator: Giovanni Russonello
item.media:credit: Travis Dove for The New York Times
item.media:description: President Trump spoke to a gathering of delegates in Charlotte, N.C., on Monday.

item.title: Trump Keeps Promoting a Drug Order That No One Has Seen
item.description: The president’s campaign has made his efforts to lower prescription drug prices a centerpiece of his re-election pitch, but the executive order remains unseen.
item.dc:creator: Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Margot Sanger-Katz
item.media:credit: Samuel Corum for The New York Times
item.media:description: President Trump displaying an executive order devised to lower prescription drug costs during an event in Washington last month.

item.title: Biden and Harris will be tested regularly for the coronavirus.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Kaplan and Katie Glueck
item.media:credit: Erin Schaff/The New York Times
item.media:description: Joseph R. Biden Jr. and Senator Kamala Harris on the last night of the Democratic National Convention.

item.title: DeJoy Defends Postal Changes as Trump Continues to Attack Voting by Mail
item.description: Facing tough questioning from a House panel, the postmaster general denounced suggestions that he was working to help President Trump politically and defended the cost-cutting changes he has overseen.
item.dc:creator: Catie Edmondson
item.category: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
item.media:credit: Pool photo by Tom Brenner
item.media:description: Louis DeJoy, the postmaster general, criticized the “false narrative” that he said was being promoted about both his intentions and the changes at the Postal Service.

item.title: Frank Cullotta, Mobster Turned Memoirist and YouTuber, Dies at 81
item.description: Mr. Cullotta testified in organized crime cases, and went on to write memoirs, give tours and speak about his life on his YouTube channel, “Coffee with Cullotta.” He died of Covid-19.
item.dc:creator: Julia Carmel

item.title: Even before Falwell resigned, he was not invited back to the Republican convention.
item.dc:creator: Glenn Thrush
item.media:credit: Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images
item.media:description: Jerry Falwell Jr., delivers a speech during the 2016 Republican National Convention in Cleveland, Ohio.

item.title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
item.description: A new study from Hong Kong details the first documented case of reinfection.
item.dc:creator: Lara Takenaga and Jonathan Wolfe
item.media:credit: The New York Times

item.title: Puerto Rican officials tested positive for the coronavirus after indoor campaign events.
item.dc:creator: Patricia Mazzei and Frances Robles
item.media:credit: House Television, via Associated Press
item.media:description: Resident Commissioner Jenniffer González-Colón of Puerto Rico tested positive for coronavirus.
